meanings.definition: To dip lightly or quickly into water or other liquid.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed dabbling her toes in the cool stream.
meanings.sent2: The children were dabbling in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The duck dabblings in the pond made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts dabblings in memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush dabblings on the canvas created a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To take part in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
meanings.sent1: He was just dabbling in painting, not taking it seriously.
meanings.sent2: She dabblings in different hobbies but never sticks with one.
meanings.sent3: The cat's dabblings in trying to catch the laser pointer were amusing.
meanings.sent4: His dabblings in politics were short-lived but memorable.
meanings.sent5: The student's dabblings in various subjects showed his curiosity.
